title: Runes are WAY Too Expensive
body: Not to mention rune pages. How are we expected to get an average champion pool plus tier 3 runes by level 30?

replies.body: rune **pages **being so expensive is the real issue.

By the time I hit 30, I had enough IP to buy the runes for an AD page, an AP page, and a support page.  And I still had almost 17k IP left to buy champs.  If I had chosen to play support champs with either the AD or AP rune setup (which isn't uncommon), I would have had another 6k IP for champs and would have only needed 2 rune pages total.

There are 12 450 IP champs, and 8 of them are picked in more than 6% of games, with 5 of them picked in more than 10% of games.  With 17k IP, you could get Annie, Garen, Yi, Sivir and Ashe and then get 10 1350 champs.  You can even get Tristana and Alistar for free (well, Garen as well).  If you don't want to give away access to personal information on Facebook/Youtube/Twitter, you could create a throw-away account on those platforms just to get those free champs.

Want a couple of 6300 IP champs?  You probably won't have enough IP to have 16 champs for ranked by level 30.  But you would only need another 7k IP or so after hitting 30 if you got 2 6300s, 8 of the 450s, and 6 of the 1350s.

Can you get 16 6300 champs by the time you hit 30 without spending any money on RP?  No.

I'm not sure what you personally consider an "average" champion pool.  If you mean a champion pool comparable to the average player, then the answer is you're not expected to have that by level 30.  And it's unreasonable for a new player to expect to have the same champion pool as an average player by the time they first hit level 30.

I think the rune prices should remain as is. Its a FREE to play game. The high rune prices are to encourage people to use RP to buy champions and runes pages. Teir 3 runes are ENDGAME content, good games don't make endgame content easily unlockable. You don't see Blizzard giving away the best-in-slot equipment to their players. No! the players have to spend hours, days, or even WEEKS to get that one little piece of equipment that is just slightly better than the second-best-in-slot.  League of Legends shouldn't be any different.  
Options for those complain about rune prices:
1. You could buy teir 2 runes, they're DIRT cheap... only like 35 IP each. If you want the best (tier 3), you have to really work for it. 
2. You could buy IP boosts to get IP to buy teir 3 runes... 
3. You could grind out the IP during party up bonus weeks (join the chat room in client "LFG" to find pickup groups to get full 5 bonus). 
4. OR you could just play to game like everyone else and just save up for them. 

I own all the champions, 20 rune pages, and I almost have ALL the runes unlocked. There wasn't really a shortcut, I've played for over 2,000 hours. haha

I've played since Season 1 and only have 5 rune pages, maybe 1/3 of the runes, and still 20 or so more champions to go. According to [this](http://wasted-on-lol.com/stats/na/caeler/), I've played 1900+ hours.

>You could buy teir 2 runes, they're DIRT cheap... only like 35 IP each. If you want the best (tier 3), you have to really work for it.

You'll be working for years at the current cost for tier 3 runes unless you play LOTS of games a day.

Not everyone has time to play a lot of games every day. Even then, it's possible to become bored after a couple of games or just not feel like playing League at the time. At that point it becomes more of a chore than anything.

>OR you could just play to game like everyone else and just save up for them.

See my first sentence.

I prefer strategical options and gameplay over statistical options. Hence, I prioritize champions. The game can be played decently well with only the two beginner rune pages and generalized runes but a lot of champions and roles will be poorly optimized. Runes aren't necessary, but they are preferred. 

A large champion pool, on the other hand, is almost required for ranked. If the enemy picks something that's good against every champion you own for that role, then you're basically screwed unless you play something off-meta. There are also times when you get forced into a role that you don't play and therefore don't have champions for. Having a bigger pool just provides many more options than having more rune choices. I can't really justify spending IP on runes and pages given their absurd costs.

None of that really has anything to do with my post though. My main point was that "endgame content" shouldn't take four years to achieve, and that's being generous with the numbers. [One of the estimations for ALL of the content is 7+ years.](https://www.reddit.com/r/leagueoflegends/comments/2gof61/about_the_ip_system_how_long_does_it_take_to/) 

To respond to **Bergk** again... Riot isn't Blizzard, and League isn't World of Warcraft. Just because Blizzard runs World of Warcraft a certain way doesn't mean Riot has to run League the same way. Saying that League shouldn't be any different is just ignorant. There are plenty of free games with similar systems that don't require such a massive amount of time to unlock all the content, and they do just fine financially.
